name: assembled
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
assemble
assemble verb
(GATHER)
C2 [ I or T ] to come together in a single place or bring parts together in a single group: We assembled in the meeting room after lunch. to assemble data At the staff meeting, the manager told the assembled company (= everyone there) that no one would lose their job.
More examplesFewer examplesWithin hours of the tragedy happening, an emergency rescue team had been assembled.He gazed once more around the room, where his entire family were assembled.Over 50,000 people assembled in the main square.He came out onto the balcony to speak to the crowd that had assembled outside.Everyone is assembling outside the cathedral, ready for the Remembrance Day parade.

assemble verb
(JOIN)
C2 [ T ] to make something by joining separate parts: furniture that is easy to assemble
